info.senderName: NWS Missoula (Western Montana and Central Idaho)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued March 30 at 11:39PM MDT until April 02 at 12:00AM MDT by NWS Missoula
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE FRIDAY NIGHT THROUGH SATURDAY EVENING ABOVE 4000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 4000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 4 to 8 inches possible for Marias Pass and the higher terrain. Winds could gust as high as 50 mph. Blowing snow could dramatically reduce visibility. Valleys below 4000 feet can expect 1 to 3 inches. * WHERE...West Glacier Region. * WHEN...From late Friday night through Saturday evening. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.
